column1: ;; Tries to correctly add the diacritical marks on words that are supposed to have them.
;; Can not work with words that are in the dictionary as separate words such as 'se' and 'sé', 'el' and 'él'.
;; Capitalises proper nouns except if they are separate words uncapitalised. For example, 'chile (pepper)' or 'Chile (country)'.
;; Places the diaeresis on words that are supposed to have them such as typing 'pinguino' results in 'pingüino'.
;; ‖CL‖ method is superior than ‖SI‖ in preventing the user from typing during the replacement of text.
;; ‖CL‖ and ‖MCL‖ are similar methods whereby ‖MCL‖ calls a menu, this is useful for gender designations and other peculiarities.
;; Auto-execute (*) should be used with automatic correcters.
;; No EndChar (O) should not be used with automatic correcters because it omits the punctuation marks that the user types.
;; Has to be case insensitive. That is, the syntaxes (C) or (C1) must not be used.
;; The spelling of the word has to match on the left and the right sides of ‖CL‖En‖
;; Reset Recognizer (Z) has to be used for proper differentiation between words.
;; Triggerstrings can be made case sensitive by using the syntax (CZ). Only to be used with proper nouns.
